text: By 2030, according to administration officials, EPA's proposal would cut CO2 emissions from 2005 levels by between 0.7 percent and 1.5 percent, compared with a business-as-usual approach. By contrast, the Clean Power Plan would have cut emissions by roughly 19 percent by 2030.
